loop.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a shape like a curve or a circle made by a line curving back towards itself, or a piece of wire, string etc that has this shape
belt loop (=a loop of material for holding a belt on trousers etc)
loop.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: A loop of wire held the gate shut.
loop.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: a set of operations in a computer program that are continuously repeated
loop.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: a film or music loop contains images or sounds that are continuously repeated
loop.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: a road or railway line that leaves the main road or track and then joins it again further on
loop.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to make a loop or make something into a loop
loop.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: He looped the rope over the post.
loop.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to move in a circular direction that forms the shape of a loop
loop.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: The ball looped over the goalkeeper into the back of the net.
loop.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: to give someone the latest news or information about a situation
loop.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: Keep me looped in on any further developments.
loop.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: the central business area of Chicago. The name comes from an elevated railway that forms a large circle or loop around the area.
loop.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: if a person is in the loop, he or she is one of the group of people who receive information about important subjects or who are involved in making important decisions
loop.translation[3].definitions[1].defin: a set of commands in a computer program that are intended to be repeated again and again
